extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

parameters.oFooter: type: sap.m.IBar, description: The footer to set

getPreserveHeaderStateOnScroll.!description:
Gets current value of property preserveHeaderStateOnScroll. Preserves the current header state when scrolling. For example, if the user expands the header by clicking on the title and then scrolls down the page, the header will remain expanded.
Note: Based on internal rules, the value of the property is not always taken into account - for example, when the control is rendered on tablet or mobile and the control`s title and header are with height larger than the given threshold. Default value is false.

destroyContent.!description: Destroys the content in the aggregation content.

destroyFooter.!description: Destroys the footer in the aggregation footer.

setHeaderExpanded.!description:
Sets a new value for property headerExpanded. Determines whether the header is expanded.
Note: Based on internal rules, the value of the property is not always taken into account - for example when the expanded header is larger than the available screen area. For those cases a warning is logged. The header can be also expanded/collapsed by user interaction, which requires the property to be internally mutated by the control to reflect the changed state. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bHeaderExpanded: type: boolean, description: New value for property headerExpanded

getHeaderExpanded.!description:
Gets current value of property headerExpanded. Determines whether the header is expanded.
Note: Based on internal rules, the value of the property is not always taken into account - for example when the expanded header is larger than the available screen area. For those cases a warning is logged. The header can be also expanded/collapsed by user interaction, which requires the property to be internally mutated by the control to reflect the changed state. Default value is true.

setShowFooter.!description: Sets a new value for property showFooter. Determines whether the footer is visible. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bShowFooter: type: boolean, description: New value for property showFooter

getFooter.!description: Gets content of aggregation footer. DynamicPage floating footer.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.f.DynamicPage with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Control.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to sap.ui.core.ElementMetadata
parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getShowFooter.!description: Gets current value of property showFooter. Determines whether the footer is visible. Default value is false.

sap.f.DynamicPage.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Dynamic Page. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getPreserveHeaderStateOnScroll preserveHeaderStateOnScroll} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getHeaderExpanded headerExpanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowFooter showFooter} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getTitle title} : sap.f.DynamicPageTitle
    • {@link #getHeader header} : sap.f.DynamicPageHeader
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getFooter footer} : sap.m.IBar
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to set

parameters.oHeader: type: sap.f.DynamicPageHeader, description: The header to set

destroyTitle.!description: Destroys the title in the aggregation title.

sap.f.DynamicPage.!description:
Overview

A {@link sap.f.DynamicPage} is a control that is used as a layout for an application. It consists of a title, a header, content and a footer. Additionally it offers dynamic behavior when scrolling, where part of the header snaps to the title.

Notes:
  • If you're displaying a {@link sap.m.FlexBox FlexBox} control with non-adaptive content (doesn't stretch to fill the available space), it is recommended to set the fitContainer property of the {@link sap.m.FlexBox FlexBox} to false.
  • If you are displaying a {@link sap.ui.table.Table}, keep in mind that it is non-adaptive and may cause unpredicted behavior for the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage} on smaller screen sizes, such as mobile.
Structure

The control consist of several components - {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle}, {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader}, a content area, and a footer:
  • {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle} - consists of a heading on the left side, content in the middle, and actions on the right. The displayed content changes based on the current mode of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader}.
  • {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader} - a generic container, which can contain a single layout control and does not care about the content alignment and responsiveness. The header works in two modes - expanded and snapped and its behavior can be adjusted with the help of different properties.
  • Content area - a generic container, which can have a single UI5 layout control and does not care about the content alignment and responsiveness.
  • Footer - positioned at the bottom with a small offset and used for additional actions, the footer floats above the content. It can be any {@link sap.m.IBar} control.
Usage

Use the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage} if you need to have a title, that is always visible and a header, that has configurable Expanding/Snapping functionality. If you don't need the Expanding/Snapping functionality it is better to use the {@link sap.m.Page} as a lighter control.

Responsive Behavior

The responsive behavior of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage} depends on the behavior of the content that is displayed.

parameters.oTitle: type: sap.f.DynamicPageTitle, description: The title to set

destroyHeader.!description: Destroys the header in the aggregation header.

setPreserveHeaderStateOnScroll.!description:
Sets a new value for property preserveHeaderStateOnScroll. Preserves the current header state when scrolling. For example, if the user expands the header by clicking on the title and then scrolls down the page, the header will remain expanded.
Note: Based on internal rules, the value of the property is not always taken into account - for example, when the control is rendered on tablet or mobile and the control`s title and header are with height larger than the given threshold. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bPreserveHeaderStateOnScroll: type: boolean, description: New value for property preserveHeaderStateOnScroll

sap.f.DynamicPage.!helpDescription:
Overview

A {@link sap.f.DynamicPage} is a control that is used as a layout for an application. It consists of a title, a header, content and a footer. Additionally it offers dynamic behavior when scrolling, where part of the header snaps to the title.

Notes:
  • If you're displaying a {@link sap.m.FlexBox FlexBox} control with non-adaptive content (doesn't stretch to fill the available space), it is recommended to set the fitContainer property of the {@link sap.m.FlexBox FlexBox} to false.
  • If you are displaying a {@link sap.ui.table.Table}, keep in mind that it is non-adaptive and may cause unpredicted behavior for the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage} on smaller screen sizes, such as mobile.
Structure

The control consist of several components - {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle}, {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader}, a content area, and a footer:
  • {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle} - consists of a heading on the left side, content in the middle, and actions on the right. The displayed content changes based on the current mode of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader}.
  • {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader} - a generic container, which can contain a single layout control and does not care about the content alignment and responsiveness. The header works in two modes - expanded and snapped and its behavior can be adjusted with the help of different properties.
  • Content area - a generic container, which can have a single UI5 layout control and does not care about the content alignment and responsiveness.
  • Footer - positioned at the bottom with a small offset and used for additional actions, the footer floats above the content. It can be any {@link sap.m.IBar} control.
Usage

Use the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage} if you need to have a title, that is always visible and a header, that has configurable Expanding/Snapping functionality. If you don't need the Expanding/Snapping functionality it is better to use the {@link sap.m.Page} as a lighter control.

Responsive Behavior

The responsive behavior of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage} depends on the behavior of the content that is displayed.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.f.DynamicPage.

showFooter.!description: Determines whether the footer is visible.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

headerExpanded.!description:
Determines whether the header is expanded.
Note: Based on internal rules, the value of the property is not always taken into account - for example when the expanded header is larger than the available screen area. For those cases a warning is logged. The header can be also expanded/collapsed by user interaction, which requires the property to be internally mutated by the control to reflect the changed state.

pinnable.!description: Determines whether the header is pinnable.

sap.f.!description: SAPUI5 library with controls specialized for Fiori applications.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised.

preserveHeaderStateOnScroll.!description:
Preserves the current header state when scrolling. For example, if the user expands the header by clicking on the title and then scrolls down the page, the header will remain expanded.
Note: Based on internal rules, the value of the property is not always taken into account - for example, when the control is rendered on tablet or mobile and the control`s title and header are with height larger than the given threshold.

sap.f.DynamicPageHeader.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DynamicPageHeader. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getPinnable pinnable} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

destroyContent.!description: Destroys all the content in the aggregation content.

insertContent.!description: Inserts a content into the aggregation content.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

sap.f.DynamicPageHeader.!description:
Overview

The {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader} control is part of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage} family and is used to serve as header of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage}.

Usage

The {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader} can hold any layout control and has two states - expanded and collapsed (snapped). The switching between these states happens when:
  • the user scrolls below its bottom margin
  • the user clicks on the {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle}
  • through the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage} property headerExpanded
Responsive Behavior

The responsive behavior of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader} depends on the behavior of the content that is displayed.

setPinnable.!description: Sets a new value for property pinnable. Determines whether the header is pinnable. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bPinnable: type: boolean, description: New value for property pinnable

  • the user scrolls below its bottom margin

Gets content of aggregation actions. The DynamicPageTitle actions.
Note: The actions aggregation accepts any UI5 control, but it`s recommended to use controls, suitable for {@link sap.m.Toolbar} and {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar}.

sap.f.DynamicPageTitle.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DynamicPageTitle. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. The supported settings are:
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getHeading heading} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getActions actions} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getSnappedContent snappedContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getExpandedContent expandedContent} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: the 0-based index the action should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the action is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the action is inserted at the last position

sap.f.DynamicPageTitle.!description:
Overview

The {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle} control is part of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage} family and is used to serve as title of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPage DynamicPage}.

Usage

The {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle} can hold any control and displays the most important information regarding the object that will always remain visible while scrolling.

Note: The actions aggregation accepts any UI5 control, but it`s recommended to use controls, suitable for {@link sap.m.Toolbar} and {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar}.

By clicking on the {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle}, the user can switch between the expanded/collapsed states of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPageHeader DynamicPageHeader}.

Responsive Behavior

The responsive behavior of the {@link sap.f.DynamicPageTitle DynamicPageTitle} depends on the behavior of the content that is displayed.

indexOfExpandedContent.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation expandedContent. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oExpandedContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The expandedContent whose index is looked for

destroyActions.!description: Destroys all the actions in the aggregation actions.

addAction.!description: Adds some action to the aggregation actions.

parameters.oAction: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: the action to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

removeAction.!description: Removes a action from the aggregation actions.

parameters.vAction: type: int|string|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The action to remove or its index or id
